intro: Lagarosolen jingxiensis, commonly known as the Jingxiensis lichen, is a unique species of lichen that belongs to the family Pilocarpaceae. It is characterized by its intricate thallus structure, which consists of a complex interweaving of fungal and algal components. This plant is typically found in humid, shaded environments, often on tree trunks or rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its growth is slow, and it plays a role in nutrient cycling within its ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
